channel.title: Object specific actions? [PI]
channel.description: So I've got a few teleporters on my server. I found a few conflicting ones (altar teleporters with spawned ones) and was wondering how I would edit the case so it would check if I'm in Region A or Region B. If in Region A, teleport here, if in Region B, teleport here.

item.title: Object specific actions? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:3, topic:483527”]Or if you want to be in a certain area to have certain teleport coordinates, just use something like this:

if (c.inArea()) c.getPA().startTeleport(Xpos, Ypos, "modern"); else c.getPA().startTeleport(Xpos2, Ypos2, "modern");

With this:

if(xCoord >= # && xCoord <= # && yCoord >= # && yCoord <= #) { doThis(); } else { doThis(); }
You have no need for the brackets unless you have more than 1 line of code in the if statement.[/quote]
I’m not using your first suggestion, because I’d have to make a set of booleans containing the area data for all my altars, which really isn’t worth it to configure one teleporter for each.

I’ll work on the second one (same as What LetterQ said)

I just need to turn debugging on.

Read full topic

item.title: Object specific actions? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Or if you want to be in a certain area to have certain teleport coordinates, just use something like this:

if (c.inArea()) c.getPA().startTeleport(Xpos, Ypos, "modern"); else c.getPA().startTeleport(Xpos2, Ypos2, "modern");

With this:

if(xCoord >= # && xCoord <= # && yCoord >= # && yCoord <= #) { doThis(); } else { doThis(); }
You have no need for the brackets unless you have more than 1 line of code in the if statement.

Read full topic
